DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Trial Implement AHCPR Smoking Cessation Guideline
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Among veteran , smoke single important risk factor preventable mortality morbidity , study suggest high prevalence smoking among veteran general population . The VHA encourage adoption AHCPR Guideline Smoking Cessation , yet hospital poorly develop smoke cessation program . Objectives : The present study design investigate effectiveness organizational strategy increase compliance AHCPR guideline . Short term goal study include increase rate identification smoker increase delivery brief smoke cessation intervention . Long term goal include reduce tobacco consumption among veteran . Methods : Twenty VAMCï¿½s active primary care clinic randomly assign either control ( usual practice ; UP ) intervention ( organizational support ; OS ) group . The intervention hospital receive staff training site consultation ; hospital receive AHCPR guideline . Rate identification smoker medical record , smoke cessation rate , provision smoking cessation service ( e.g. , NRT , counsel ) , cost NRT determine via telephone interview patient , chart review , electronic record . Status : Baseline data collection nearly complete , intervention period complete September , 2000 . We complete telephone survey approximately 4500 veteran . Analysis study data ongoing , manuscript preparation begin within next month .
